story_txt:
Presenting the first evidence-based complete probiotics formula: Thrive by MDBiotics

Our gastrointestinal system harbors 100 trillion microbial cells, which influence our overall health including the nutrition, metabolism, physiology, and immune function of our body. Some of these bacteria are good and some are not. The good bacteria keep the bad bacteria in check. This overall bacterial population has a symbiotic (mutually beneficial) relationship with our body. Research is increasingly showing that this symbiotic relationship is critical for overall health and wellness and its disruption contributes to progression of a number of diseases. Bacterial imbalance in the gut is proving to be a common pathway for progression of many conditions, including age-related reduction in metabolism, memory loss, dementia, heart disease, gastrointestinal disease, kidney disease, obesity and weight gain. Gut bacterial imbalance and protein fermentation by gut bacteria generates a myriad of toxic metabolites called endotoxins, including p-cresol and indoxyl sulfate. An unhealthy gut bacterial imbalance allows transfer of these toxins to all over the body, which contributes to inflammation, aging, and progression of disease.

Not all probiotics are created equal. MDBiotic’s probiotics (friendly bacteria) re-establishes intestinal symbiosis and neutralizes bacterial endotoxins. Studies behind Thrive by MDBiotics’ formula prove that probiotics have therapeutic roles in maintaining a metabolically-balanced gut microbiota and promoting a healthy body and brain.

 
Think of Thrive as the multivitamin of probiotics, except it is based on data. 
After 7 years of research and studying various strains of probiotics, we have come up with a complete proprietary formula that contains 9 specific strains of probiotics that have been shown to aid multiple conditions and in keeping a healthy body and mind. The specific strains and dosage of live probiotics in Thrive has been proven to re-establish this symbiosis and improve metabolism and weight, improve multiple conditions such as blood glucose in diabetes, improve blood pressure, improve migraine headaches, improve gastrointestinal pain, improve uremia in kidney disease, improve memory in Alzheimer’s patients, improve mood and reduce symptoms of anxiety and depression.
Thrive is not just for those who are striving to become healthier. Thrive plays a protective role and should be part of a healthy lifestyle.
 
How is Thrive by MDBiotics different?
There are hundreds of strains (different types) of probiotics. Some are more effective than others and some are not only ineffective, but can lead to undesired side effects, such as weight gain. Thrive by MDBiotics is the first evidence-based probiotics formula on the market. This means MDBiotics’ formula is the result of hundreds of peer-reviewed publications and thousands of data points. See our bibliography at the bottom of the page. MDBiotics’ proprietary formula contains live cultures and 9 specific clinically tested strains of probiotics that have been shown to promote overall health, increase metabolism, stabilize blood glucose, improve blood pressure, improve migraine headaches, improve gastrointestinal pain, improve uremia in kidney disease, play a protective role in memory loss, improve memory in Alzheimer’s patients, improve mood and reduce symptoms of anxiety and depression. Think of this formula as the “multi-vitamin” of probiotics.


 

The science: What is the gut microbiome?
The human gut harbors a complex community of 100 trillion microbial cells that constitute the gut microbiota. The combined microbial genome of the gut microbiota is known as the gut microbiome. In general, the adult gut is dominated by two bacterial phyla, Firmicutes and Bacteroidetes; other phyla, including Actinobacteria, Proteobacteria, Verrucomicrobia, Cyanobacteria, Fusobacteria, Spirochaetes, and others, are present in smaller proportions. Each species of bacteria colonizes a specific niche, leading to different bacterial composition along the intestinal tract. Gut microbiota performs a multitude of functions and can be considered a metabolically active “organ” in itself. Under physiologic conditions, it participates in certain complementary metabolic activities that have not been fully evolved in the human host, such as breakdown of indigestible plant polysaccharides, synthesis of certain vitamins, biotransformation of conjugated bile acids, and degradation of dietary oxalates. Importantly, postnatal colonization of the intestine educates our immune system and reduces allergic responses to food and environmental antigens. Metabolism and Weight loss
Recent research findings suggest that our gut microbiota might be involved in the development of obesity and related disorders, such as insulin resistance. Weight gain is associated with an increase in the capacity of the microbiota to extract nutrients from the diet and in inducing metabolic changes in the host, such as increased fatty acid oxidation in muscle and increased triglyceride storage in the liver. Restoring a healthy gut with specific probiotics has been shown to lead the body towards healthier weights. Most probiotics formulas do not consider the weight loss or weight gain effect of their strains. Our team has done a lot of research into coming up with a formula that is holistic and considers all factors including weight loss. Probiotics have also been shown to possess antioxidant and free radical scavenging abilities, both of which are known for anti-aging properties and contribute to a healthier body.
Heart Health
The association between bacteria and atherosclerosis- clogging of arteries that lead to heart disease, has been known for more than two decades. Recently, focus has shifted from bacteria to its product, endotoxin, for its role in the development of atherosclerosis. Endotoxin is a key factor in initiation and progression of atherosclerosis through injuring the cells lining our arteries. Furthermore, vascular smooth muscle cells, one population of cells lining our arteries, exhibit profound responsiveness to even very low levels of endotoxin. Elevated endotoxin level is a strong risk factor for the development of atherosclerosis in the general population. Elevated plasma level of endotoxins is noted in patients with unstable angina, a dangerous heart condition that could lead to heart attack and is related to increased stiffness of aorta and plaque formation in the arteries supplying blood to the brain.  Specific probiotic strains in THRIVE have been shown to counteract buildup of endotoxins and reverse their toxicity.
Kidney Health
The gastrointestinal system is at the interphase between the blood and the potentially toxic contents of the gut. Histologic changes in the intestines at the molecular level, with inflammatory cells, are noted in chronic kidney disease. Uremia (build up of toxins in the blood) increases intestinal permeability, allowing movement of bacteria and endotoxins across the intestinal wall into the blood and the entire body.  Factors that promote intestinal dysbiosis  (imbalance) also contribute to the leaky gut in kidney disease. Gut microbiome dysbiosis is linked to micro-inflammation in patients with kidney disease. Specific probiotic strains in THRIVE have been shown to improve buildup of toxins (uremia) and counteract the toxicity.
Memory, Dementia and Alzheimer’s disease.
Dementia is a syndrome that affects memory and other cognitive functions to the extent that it interferes with daily function. There are many conditions that can cause dementia, including Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease. New research indicates that gastrointestinal tract microbiota (see definition above) are directly linked to memory functioning through triggering metabolic diseases and low-grade inflammation progress.
Alzheimer's disease is associated with severe cognitive impairments as well as some metabolic defects. Studies including a double-blind, and controlled clinical trial which was conducted among Alzheimer’s disease patients to assess the effects of probiotic supplementation on cognitive function and metabolic status have proven the connection between a healthy gastrointestinal system and the brain. After 12 weeks, the probiotic supplemented group showed a significant (more than 25%) improvement in memory.
Improving Mood, Anxiety, Depression and Migraine Headaches
Multiple randomized controlled trials have linked specific strains of probiotics in Thrive’s formula to improving mood, anxiety, depression and reducing severity of migraine headaches.
People suffering from depression experience significant mood, anxiety, and cognitive symptoms. Currently, most antidepressants work by altering neurotransmitter activity in the brain to improve these symptoms. However, in the last decade, research has revealed an extensive bidirectional communication network between the gastrointestinal tract and the central nervous system, referred to as the "gut-brain axis." Advances in this field have linked psychiatric disorders to changes in the microbiota. There is mounting evidence that the intestinal microbiota influences and modulates emotional behavior. This communication network between the gastrointestinal system and brain goes both directions and occurs via the autonomic nervous system, the enteric nervous system (nerve cells outside the lumen of the intestines), the neuroendocrine system, and the immune system. Several studies have looked at isolated nutrients and their impact on mental health. Central to this research are probiotics, defined as live microorganisms that, when ingested in adequate amounts, exert a health benefit on the host. Probiotics are transient entities that colonize the GI tract and influence various pathways. It has been well established that probiotics have therapeutic effects on many GI disorders such as inflammatory bowl disease; however, with the emergence of the gut–brain axis, it has been discovered that their therapeutic effects extend beyond the gut and into the central nervous system. There is robust evidence of this in multiple studies that have demonstrated probiotics’ ability to change behavior and improve the mood, anxiety and cognition of humans. Multiple studies have also shown that the specific strains of probiotics in Thrive have beneficial effects on the frequency and severity of migraine headache attacks.
Probiotics have also been shown to possess both antioxidant and free radical scavenging abilities, increase production of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA), and improve absorption of other nutrients, all of which have been implicated in the pathophysiology of stress, anxiety and depression.
Dose and Directions
Thrive’s dosing is data-driven. The twice-daily dose of 5 billion SPECIFIC probiotics in this formula has been shown to be the most effective compared to other doses. Our doctors recommend you take one capsule once daily before bed for one week, and twice daily after that. The best times to take Thrive are after breakfast and before bed.
Storage & Expiration
Thrive’s cutting-edge live-culture formulation means it can be stored at room temperature safely for up to 2 years.

story:
Pavel Idelevich, M.D., CEO:

 

Although trained in internal medicine and pathology, Idelevich has largely remained focused on basic cell biology, as it applies to disease states and the aging process. Prior to forming Prescient Pharma, Idelevich’s work has led to the isolation and identification of rare circulating fetal and tumor cells, currently in development by EarlyCell. He is also responsible for the development and commercialization of several histochemical kits currently used in cancer detection. Originally from the former Soviet Georgia, Idelevich spent over a decade working in Israel at the Weizmann Institute and in industry.

Kenneth Reed, M.D., Vice President:

Kenneth Reed M.D. is a board certified practicing dermatologist, with a keen interest in biotechnology and drug development. A graduate of the College of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey and the combined Residency Dermatology Program of Harvard Medical School, Dr. Reed founded DermAsap where he continues to practice and serve as a principle clinical investigator.
Dr. Reed is on the board of directors of RedHill Biopharma, Minerva Biotechnologies, and a cofounder of EarlyCell, a company dedicated to isolating circulating fetal and tumor cells.

CELLREGENX is a daily supplement scientifically developed to make living cells perform more like younger cells. As cells age, they lose their ability to fend off metabolic byproducts which can result in intracellular acidification. By restoring a more balanced intracellular state, many cellular functions return to levels previously expressed by younger healthier cells. 
Mitochondria, the source of energy production in cells function less efficiently as cells age. CELLREGENX by restoring the intracellular environment. Cellregenx increased significantly length of telomeres in the human volunteers in our clinical studies. 
CELLREGNX was carefully formulated by medical researchers and physicians attempting to isolate compounds that could allow older cells to chemically behave like their younger predecessors. Although multiple natural products and ingredients were explored, it was discovered that there was a unique synergism found when licorice root powder and lithium orotate were combined in a specific ratio. This unanticipated finding is patent pending, was not seen with either ingredient alone, and was dependent upon a unique ratio of the two co-products

We truly believe that Cellregenx is currently the best product on the market for cellular rejuvenation. We are trying to raise money to be able to fund our marketing activities as well as development of new generation of Cellregenx

story:
Fitness Is Only One Dimension Of Health

Wearable fitness trackers and smartwatches have been all the rage but are they really improving your health?  Most track not much more than physical activity with manufacturer preset sensors. Sensors that are meant to collect a few common parameters such as walking distance, steps, heart rate. But everyone is different, and these parameters may not be the most important to an individual’s particular health needs and conditions. Plus, health needs and conditions change over time.

Not to mention the fact that sensors are getting outdated in their capability and accuracy all the time. This is only going to accelerate as new sensor technologies are developed making possible new kinds of measurement with higher levels of accuracy. But once a fitness tracker or a smartwatch with their preset sensors is outdated, the only way to benefit from the new technologies is to get the next device.


Doctoh. Personalizeable. Updateable.

What if there was a health wearable that was modular and easily changeable? Allowing each person to simply change the sensors to measure the parameters most important to them. Meet Doctoh, a patent pending wrist wearable system with changeable sensor bands. Each sensor band comes with the most complete group of sensors today’s technologies can provide to measure the parameters related to a specific need. 

Snap in the Doctoh Fitness Band and the device can monitor heart rate, skin temperature, skin moisture, movement, location, and skin conductance. Easily detach the band using a secure lock-and-release mechanism and now you can attach the Doctoh Heart Band that addresses specific cardiac monitoring needs such as heart rate, heart rhythm, blood pressure and blood vessel resistance. New sensor technologies become available to measure even more parameters or measure existing ones much more accurately. No problem, just take out the old band and replace with the new one containing the very latest sensors.

Such easy changeability achieves a significant level of personalization for the particular health monitoring needs of an individual. And as the needs change, the sensor bands can snap out and new ones snap in without the need to get a new device. As new sensor technology becomes available for a particular health condition, you only need to replace the current band instead of getting a new device. No need to get used to a whole another device, a whole another interface.

In fact, such a system has the potential for use in doctor offices, even hospitals.  Imagine a patient wearing a Doctoh device equipped with specific modules addressing their individual medical conditions. The Doctoh app simply streams the information wirelessly from the device, directly to the physician. It even identifies alerts depending on the condition being monitored so that proactive actions or timely follow-ups to any issues can be performed.

Furthermore, hospital administrators can save valuable time when overworked nursing staffs can put a Doctoh Hospital Band on a patient's wrist and have the vital signs, pulse oximetry and other important parameters wirelessly transmitted to monitors at the nursing station. Software integration with Electronic Medical Records may also be possible in the near future. RFID tracking technology incorporated in the Doctoh Hospital Band could allow doctors, nurses and other medical team support staff to physically locate the patient in the facility no matter where the patient has been sent for testing or treatment. A patient's medical record number, insurance information, health history, medication list and drug allergies can be stored in the Doctoh Hospital Band allowing software integration with Pharmacy services to avoid potential conflicts or adverse drug interactions when new medications are prescribed. Hospital billing for each service rendered can be done by simply scanning the patient's Doctoh. 

Then when the patient is ready to be discharged, the Doctoh Hospital Band can be easily switched to the one most suited for that patient’s post discharge monitoring, for instance a Doctoh Heart Band for post cardiac care, a Doctoh Worksafety Band after a heat stroke related to occupational heat exposure, or a Doctoh Metabolics Band to help monitor a patient with a diabetic complication.

The flexibility and modular design of Doctoh makes it the one system an individual will ever need for monitoring and tracking the many dimensions of health data they will need through the years.  So be a part of the future and support us in making it a reality! Because health monitoring that really improves health has many dimensions. Fitness is only just one of them.


Where Is Doctoh Today

February 2015. We completed a design brief. Yes, we called our device healthring then. 


March 2015. We conducted extensive product image research and completed our initial design sketches.


April 2015. We better understood the conceptual limitations involved in achieving our two main goals of changeability and simplicity in usage. So we went back to the drawing board and completed another round of design sketches.


May 2015. We picked an affordable off the shelf display unit with good specs for our prototype and completed design sketches to incorporate this while further fine tuning the concept.


June 2015. We completed 3D modeling and built study models to validate usability, form factor, and mechanical engineering aspects. The initial ABS rapid study models were certainly large!


August 2015. We fine tuned the design to trim dimensions and improve the lock-and-release mechanisms. We developed an innovative resizer system so the device can easily adjust to fit different wrist sizes comfortably. Then we worked with several prototyping suppliers to get micromachined body parts, connectors, molds and materials, to complete the mechanical prototype. And, we renamed our device “Doctoh”.


October 2015. We sourced inexpensive off the shelf sensors, a new blutooth communications chip, a battery and other electrical components and designed the PCB. We completed PCB fabrication and full component assembly. There were some glitches with the first circuit – it did not work properly with the display! We resolved the issues and completed the electronics prototype.


January 2016. We completed planning for the manufacturing of the device and are raising the necessary funds. So be a part of the future and support us in making it a reality! Because health monitoring that really improves health has many dimensions. Fitness is only just one of them.


What We Need Now

A great deal of further development work still needs to be completed before we can release the specifications to a manufacturer for a retail product. The funds raised will be used to complete all this work till Summer-Fall 2016.

Sensor Bands:

1.  Refine, prototype, validate and fully specify sensor flex circuit with standardized interface connectors, sensor mount placeholder for solder assembly repeatability, positioning method/secondary holding substrate for elastomeric band overmold process etc.

2.  Research, prototype, validate and fully specify OEM sensor configurations. Validation testing with each sensor configuration to establish reliable, repeatable and reasonably accurate function, manufacturing repeatability and cost effectiveness, field reliability and potential failure modes, and environmental use standards i.e. functional temperature ranges and such

3.  Refine, prototype, validate and fully specify the modular/universal lock-and-release system, for the sensor bands as well as the wrist resizer system

Primary Electronics & Housing

4.  Refine, prototype, validate and fully specify primary electronic PCB to efficiently and reliably

5.  communicate with each fully specified OEM sensor band, send and receive communications, achieve optimal battery life, support optimal screen size and type etc.

6.  Refine, prototype, validate and fully specify primary electronics housing incorporating desirable consumer grade materials, aesthetic details, mechanical tolerance requirements, protective lens, interface features, and tolerances, environmental requirements, ruggedness/durability etc.

Software and User Interface

7.  Refine, prototype, validate and fully specify device software, display user interface information and graphics, tactile switch type and correlating functionality, audible feedback/indication, tactile feedback/indication to effectively interact with end users

8.  Validate and fully specific communications and control for each fully specified OEM sensor band

9.  Develop, debug, and publish the tracking application that communicates with and tracks device use, including alert algorithms, data security/encryption, and user management

Production Documentation & Packaging

10.  Fully document each functionally validated sensor and electronic component, band and

housing component/assembly for both Alpha test market production as well as higher Beta production volumes

11.  Conceptualize, refine, prototype, validate and fully specify a packaging design, including

graphics, labeling bar codes etc. to be used in distribution

Fully document each packaging component for both Alpha test market production as well as higher Beta production volumes

Testing & Certifications

12.  Identify required tests per market requirements, such as CE, then source and coordinate the certification with 3rd party lab/s to conduct necessary tests such as drop tests, water ingress etc.

13.  Adjust any design, engineering and corresponding documentation as required to meet any required test standards

Here is the breakdown of the estimated funding requirements for this work:

story:
Somos un grupo de emprendedores amantes del deporte, sobre todo el running, que vimos la necesidad de crear esta app con el fin de encontrar rutas adecuadas para realizar esta actividad con comodidad y seguridad, además tendremos la opción de crear nuestro perfil y activando nuestro GPS encontrar más personas con la misma pasión por el running, de esa manera formaremos grupos de entrenamiento y compartiremos nuestros logros, avances y consejos con nuestros nuevos amigos, ya sea en el exterior o en tu país.

Gracias a los colaboradores lograremos que correr se vuelva un hábito en la sociedad, lograremos que el gobierno se de cuenta que necesitamos más espacios deportivos, incentivaremos el deporte con el fin de generar bienestar físico y mental; evitaremos la vida sedentaria, estrés, depresión, enfermedad, obesidad, etc. Lograremos tantas cosas en bienestar no solo nuestro si no también de todas las personas, no esperes más y se parte de este cambio!!

Necesitamos de este financiamiento para poder desarrollar un app atractiva que te atrape desde el momento que ingresas en ella, no será una de aquellas tradicionales que tiene algunas marcas deportivas, marcaremos la diferencia al compartir tus logros con la comunidad y que disfrutes de rutas adecuadas y seguras las cuales se irán actualizando constantemente en base a la experiencia de los usuarios.

Tendremos varias recompensas que seguramente te motivarán a apoyarnos en esta genial idea, entre ellas tenemos:

  • Líder de equipos: premiaremos tu constancia al nombrarte líder de equipo y tendrás como reto lograr que miembros de la comunidad no desistan del objetivo que se trazan al usar esta app. Serás como un entrenador personal para ellos.
  • Descuento con marcas exclusivas: al ser parte de la comunidad tendrás descuento en tus artículos deportivos.
  • Video promocional: participarás de los vídeos promocionales que realizaremos.
  • Testimonios de vida: Podrás contarle al mundo tu testimonio de vida y como el correr te cambio la vida.

Este proyecto es valioso pues el deporte no solo se deja ver en nuestro estado físico,  si no que también ayuda a mejorar nuestro bienestar tanto físico o mental, como decían los griegos "Mente sana en cuerpo sano", si tu formas parte de nuestra comunidad vas a lograr mejorar tu autoestima y esto incidirá en que te sientas capaz de conseguir otros objetivos en otras áreas de tu vida.

Entrevista a Yolanda Torres, corredora que nos cuenta porque le gusta correr y valida nuestro proyecto!! :) 
 

También dale me gusta a nuestro fan page https://www.facebook.com/lestrun/  y pagina web https://lizescudero70.wixsite.com/misitio-1  donde encontrarás la mejor información para corredores. Asimismo, dale click al siguiente enlace donde Lizbeth Escudero te contará un poco más de este proyecto   http://mailvu.com/msg/id280ddf27f3742df8a807aba...

Historia de Vida

Gracias a Anabel Avila por dejarnos compartir su historia de éxito, es muy gratificante saber que el deporte no solo realiza grandes cambios físicos, si no, también te ayuda a elevar tu autoestima al ayudarte a encontrarte contigo misma(o), limpiar tu alma y tu cuerpo. Sentirte bien por dentro y por fuera.

En la foto de la izquierda vivía en Australia desde hacía solo unos 6 meses, pero no necesité más tiempo para decir: ¡Hasta aquí! La ropa que llevaba de Barcelona ya no me cabía, algo estaba pasando.

Había dejado de ir al gimnasio como acostumbraba a hacer en Barcelona. En Australia no sabía si me quedaría a vivir más tiempo, y ya cuando renové el visado para 3 años dije… ¡de cabeza al gimnasio! 

Además, había estado comiendo lo que podía, trabajando en restaurantes, sin demasiadas nociones de nutrición, comía realmente lo que me apetecía… Y supongo que el estrés de estar en un país buscándote la vida tampoco ayudaría mucho.

Recuerdo que siempre había sido una chica bastante menudita, he estado años pesando 49 kg.  Cuando me fui a vivir a Australia sé que pesaba 62 kg.

Entonces decidí empezar con el deporte, específicamente salir a correr, el proceso fue lento pero gratificante, como cualquier cosa de las que haces en la vida que valga la pena. Habían días que no me apetecía salir a correr, o comer bien, y quería hacer todo lo contrario. Hubieron días que mi fuerza de voluntad se impuso y días que no. Pero casi siempre ganó mi cabezonería por encima de todo.

Me llevó tiempo volver a tener confianza en mí, tener una relación sana con la comida, y entender que esto se trataba de un estilo de vida que iba a tener que llevar conmigo para siempre. Que tenía que sentirme cómoda con él porque no pensaba volver a las andadas.

Este sin duda fue mi primer cambio, pero he seguido cambiando a lo largo del tiempo y puedo ver de nuevo grandes diferencias a partir del 2013.

Todo esto junto ha hecho que sea quien soy hoy. He aprendido a creer en mí, a sentirme bien por dentro y por fuera, a verme bien y sin complejos. Eso es gracias a los valores que se potencian en este deporte, todo el mundo que lo ha probado entiende a qué me refiero, el correr te transforma, sea cual sea tu punto de partida y tu objetivo inicial. 

Si estás viviendo este largo proceso de cambio y sientes que no hay evolución, echa la vista lo suficientemente atrás para percibir el camino ya recorrido, las cosas que ya has conseguido y no seas tan exigente contigo mismo pensando sólo en las que te faltan.

Todo aquello que vale la pena necesita su tiempo.

Sobretodo recuerda porqué has llegado a esta situación en la que te has planteado que quieres cambiar, y no olvides ese motivo jamás.

TODA AYUDA ES BIENVENIDA, solo contactate con nosotros a través de nuestro fan page, ayúdanos difundiendo nuestra campaña, veraz que te sentirás bien al ayudar a promover un bienestar para la sociedad.
story_txt:
Somos un grupo de emprendedores amantes del deporte, sobre todo el running, que vimos la necesidad de crear esta app con el fin de encontrar rutas adecuadas para realizar esta actividad con comodidad y seguridad, además tendremos la opción de crear nuestro perfil y activando nuestro GPS encontrar más personas con la misma pasión por el running, de esa manera formaremos grupos de entrenamiento y compartiremos nuestros logros, avances y consejos con nuestros nuevos amigos, ya sea en el exterior o en tu país.
Gracias a los colaboradores lograremos que correr se vuelva un hábito en la sociedad, lograremos que el gobierno se de cuenta que necesitamos más espacios deportivos, incentivaremos el deporte con el fin de generar bienestar físico y mental; evitaremos la vida sedentaria, estrés, depresión, enfermedad, obesidad, etc. Lograremos tantas cosas en bienestar no solo nuestro si no también de todas las personas, no esperes más y se parte de este cambio!!
Necesitamos de este financiamiento para poder desarrollar un app atractiva que te atrape desde el momento que ingresas en ella, no será una de aquellas tradicionales que tiene algunas marcas deportivas, marcaremos la diferencia al compartir tus logros con la comunidad y que disfrutes de rutas adecuadas y seguras las cuales se irán actualizando constantemente en base a la experiencia de los usuarios.


Tendremos varias recompensas que seguramente te motivarán a apoyarnos en esta genial idea, entre ellas tenemos:

Líder de equipos: premiaremos tu constancia al nombrarte líder de equipo y tendrás como reto lograr que miembros de la comunidad no desistan del objetivo que se trazan al usar esta app. Serás como un entrenador personal para ellos.
Descuento con marcas exclusivas: al ser parte de la comunidad tendrás descuento en tus artículos deportivos.
Video promocional: participarás de los vídeos promocionales que realizaremos.
Testimonios de vida: Podrás contarle al mundo tu testimonio de vida y como el correr te cambio la vida.

Este proyecto es valioso pues el deporte no solo se deja ver en nuestro estado físico,  si no que también ayuda a mejorar nuestro bienestar tanto físico o mental, como decían los griegos "Mente sana en cuerpo sano", si tu formas parte de nuestra comunidad vas a lograr mejorar tu autoestima y esto incidirá en que te sientas capaz de conseguir otros objetivos en otras áreas de tu vida. 




Entrevista a Yolanda Torres, corredora que nos cuenta porque le gusta correr y valida nuestro proyecto!! :) 
 
También dale me gusta a nuestro fan page https://www.facebook.com/lestrun/  y pagina web https://lizescudero70.wixsite.com/misitio-1  donde encontrarás la mejor información para corredores. Asimismo, dale click al siguiente enlace donde Lizbeth Escudero te contará un poco más de este proyecto   http://mailvu.com/msg/id280ddf27f3742df8a807aba...

story:
How does The Kit work

The Kit uses amino acids to boost the liver and counteract alcohol toxicity without eliminating the buzz. It works naturally with your body's most powerful antioxidant to detox the liver as you drink, while allowing the brain to stay focused. The Kit enhances the drinking experience and prevents symptoms of hangover the next day.

Ingredients and Benefits

Ingredients: N-Acetyl Cysteine, L-Glutamine, Glycine, L-Tyrosine.

No fillers. No side effects.

The future of The Kit

The Kit formula has gone through 5 years of intense research and 3 years of testing. There is currently no supplement you can take before drinking that does what our product does.

We are so confident in our product that we've planned out the next 5 years of improvements. Currently, the product is in Version 1.0 and has a serving size of 4. 

Our goal is to make Version 2.0 have a serving size of 2. It will be sold at a wholesale price and will make this an inexpensive and healthy solution. There will also be an extra strength option of this product.

As for Version 3.0, there will be a Before and After formula, eliminating poor sleep quality due to a hangover. This version will further help you have a great time, and not have to pay for it in the morning.

The Perks

Where is the scientific research

Here is a sample of the principle studies that were used in formulating The Kit. 

Effect of alcohol abuse and glutathione administration

Glutathione Depletion and Recovery After Acute Ethanol Administration

N-acetyl cysteine in the treatment of alcohol use disorder

N-acetylcysteine attenuates alcohol-induced oxidative stress

N-acetylcysteine Prevents Alcohol Related Neuroinflammation

Acute tyrosine depletion and alcohol ingestion

Dopamine synthesis in alcohol drinking

Dysregulated Glycine Signaling Contributes to Increased Impulsivity during Protracted Alcohol Abstinence

Risks and challenges

This is our eight campaign and first time on Indiegogo. We need your help and encouragement to make The Kit a reality. If you have any questions, feel free to ask.

story:
From our experience running over 500 professional hair salons worldwide, we know that salon aftercare is not tailored to the unique needs of every individual clients’ hair. We were inspired by our clients to create Viv, a shampoo and conditioner custom made just for you.

In our salons, we take special care and attention for each person’s needs, and we believe that you should have that same level of personalized hair care at home.

 

Personalized Hair Care Made Easy

Viv makes designing your own custom shampoo and conditioner simple: answer five questions about your hair, add three infusions, choose your favorite color and one of our luxurious scents, and have the perfect hair care set delivered right to your door!

Our experience cutting and coloring over two million people, we’re passionate about hair and what we put in it. Viv strives to use only the best ingredients and ensure that our product is paraben and cruelty-free.

Make buying one-size-fits-all haircare a thing of the past and experience a shampoo and conditioner that’s made especially for you!

 

Why a crowdfunding campagne

We are now, with your answers to our few questions, able to manually make the perfect shampoo & conditioner tailored just to yóur hair.

Doing this manually, however, takes a huge amount of time.

With your help, we will set up a specific production-space with tools to help us reduce the manual parts to a minimum, so our experts can focus on continuously creating even better formulas and products.

story:
The Dentist Version.

Your dentist is needed to fit the device to your upper jaw. This version is not available at this time. Please visit archlifter.com to sign up for the newsletter. You will get updates as they become available.

The Universal Version.

For most patients, a dentist is not necessary to use this version. To use the Universal Version, you do not need any teeth. This is the version is currently being crowdfunded. See Q&A below.

The Universal Version uses a super-soft silicone rubber palate pad to provide the lifting force on the maxillary bone. While very stable, you may need to use the hand-holds to help steady the pusher on your palate. This is especially the case when you have no upper teeth.

The Archlifter™ uses the strongest traction points on the human skull:

The upper jaw and the occiput. These traction points have important advantages that allow the Archlifter™ to deliver safe and effective traction. The upper jaw is a very strong arch, and this is the key to the Archlifter’s unique effectiveness.

The Archlifter™ is easy to use.

Make sure to use a sturdy overhead mount (or weight machine).

Use the hand-holds to steady yourself and bend at the knees to apply traction forces. You use your body weight to stretch your neck. Start with a slight amount of weight, and gradually increase the applied weight until you work the kinks out.

The Archlifter™ is very effective!

 

Dr. Savage has other ideas to help make health care more efficient, effective and cost less. With your help, we can bring this product to market and make patients everywhere healthier and happier. We would also like to conduct more research on how to help patients who suffer from scoliosis and advanced cervical disease. We also want to document how using the Archlifter™ can help patients with sleep apnea. With your help and backing, the research can be done as the Archlifter™ balanced traction technology becomes widely known and adopted.

The EU

Archlifter™ will also be in Tübingen, Germany shortly as we expand to serve the EU marketplace. We hope to bring our healing technology to Europe and beyond.

Project Owner:  Devin Savage D.M.D.

Business Strategy Consultant: Thomas E. Savage Sr. MBA, CBC

Crowdfunding Management/IT support: Beth and Doug Eckersley

IP: Michael J. Gallagher Esq.

Legal: Eric Rosenberg (Rosenberg and Ball Co. LPA, Granville, OH)

Testing and Evaluation: Dr. Thomas Walters/Dr. Lisa Walters (Erie, PA)

Design and Manufacturing Tech: Mark Mnich and Johannes Hertrich, Priority Designs,
Columbus, OH

Rene Cailliet M.D., medical author and former director of the department of physical medicine and rehabilitation at the University of Southern California stated:

“Head in forward posture can add up to thirty pounds of abnormal leverage on the cervical spine. This can pull the entire spine out of alignment. Forward head posture (FHP) may result in the loss of 30% of vital lung capacity. These breath-related effects are primarily due to the loss of the cervical lordosis, which blocks the action of the hyoid muscles, especially the inferior hyoid responsible for helping lift the first rib during inhalation.”

There is a growing body of evidence accumulating in the literature supporting the hypothesis that anatomical alterations, including Forward Head Posture, contribute to sleep disordered breathing. At least one study concluded that the further forward the head posture, the more strong the association with Obstructive Sleep Apnea (1). Forward head posture (or text-neck) can increase the upper airway resistance in children as well as adults. This can contribute to Upper Airway Resistance Syndrome (UARS). This syndrome is characterized by a general lack of sleep, poor posture and dental malformations. If you or your child exhibit these symptoms, please seek help from a specialized sleep center for complete diagnosis.

 

Does the FDA regulate traction devices?

Under the published Code of Federal Regulations, 888.5850 - CFR - Code of Federal Regulations Title 21 the regulation reads:

§ 888.5850 Nonpowered orthopedic traction apparatus and accessories.

(a)Identification. A nonpowered orthopedic traction apparatus is a device that consists of a rigid frame with nonpowered traction accessories, such as cords, pulleys, or weights, and that is intended to apply a therapeutic pulling force to the skeletal system.

(b)Classification. Class I (general controls). The device is exempt from the premarket notification procedures in subpart E of part 807 of this chapter, subject to the limitations in § 888.9. The device is also exempt from the current good manufacturing practice requirements of the quality system regulation in part 820 of this chapter, with the exception of § 820.180, regarding general requirements concerning records, and § 820.198, regarding complaint files. [ 52 FR 33702, Sept. 4, 1987, as amended at 66 FR 38815, July 25, 2001]

What amount of weight can I use with the Archlifter™?

This is where sensibility is the best policy. To use the Universal Version of the Archlifter™ start with a small traction force. This means that when you attach the Archlifter™ to the sturdy overhead support (such as a pull up bar) use the extension straps (included) to bring the traction device to head level. After mounting into the device, grab onto the handles and slowly start to bend your knees to place some of your weight on the Archlifter™. A small amount of weight is the best place to start. Once you start to feel the traction forces in your neck, hold steady without adding more weight for a minute. Increase the time and traction force (body weight) as you can tolerate. It’s common to feel a bit of soreness the day after. This should not cause you to worry, but if you do feel soreness, back off your routine to allow the soreness to resolve before moving on with your traction routine. Large, sudden increases in traction forces are associated with a higher incidence of side-effects, while slower, incremental increases in traction forces are better tolerated. For many smaller adults, a peak traction force of only 35 lbs over time is sufficient to reverse the effects of gravity and screen hunch, while larger individuals may need a peak traction force of 50 to 75 lbs plus. There is no reason or known benefit to use more than 50% of body weight. In obese adults the percentage of body weight will be smaller, and using the ideal weight to calculate traction force is more realistic and reasonable.

I have dentures. Can I use the Archlifter™?

The Archlifter™ has an interchangeable strut that supports the maxillary pusher. The maxillary pusher can be one of two types: The Universal Version or the Dentist Version. The Universal Version was designed to be used independent of teeth, no teeth or palate size. If you are a denture or partial denture wearer, please take the removable dentures out before using the Archlifter™. The palate pusher applies forces to the roof of the mouth (the palate) and the denture may break or interfere with the function of the soft silicone pushing pad. Your dentist can fabricate a custom made palatal coverage appliance specifically to function with the Archlifter™.

I have a palatal torus. Can I use the Archlifter™?

A palatal torus is a small or large benign bony lump that is sometimes on the roof of the mouth. The palatal pushing pad is very soft and should not irritate the torus. However, if your torus is unusually large or sensitive, try using the super-soft sleeve that fits over the palatal pad. This will make for more of a mouthful, but will have additional cushioning power.

I have a very narrow, tall palate. Can I use the Archlifter™?

If your palate is unusually small or narrow or V-shaped, you best option is to use the super-soft sleeve over the palatal pad. The sleeve may overlap onto the teeth a bit. You should still be able to use the Archlifter™. If you are still having problems finding a comfortable fit, please visit your dentist for advice and solutions.

I have weak, questionable teeth or bridges in my upper jaw. Can I use the Archlifter™?

In this case- whether you know you already have questionable or bad or decayed teeth, old bridges, loose teeth, crowns or fillings, or gum disease or implants, you must get checked by your dentist prior to using the Archlifter™.

I have a cleft palate. Can I use the Archlifter™?

If you have a cleft palate, with or without an obturator, you should ask your dentist whether or not the Universal Version is appropriate. The super-soft sleeve solves most of these problems, however your dentist will need to determine the suitability of your palate to absorb the traction forces. In the case there is little or no actual bone in the palatal area, your best advice may be to have a custom dental appliance made by your dentist. Please consult your dental professional for more information.

I have had head and/or neck surgery. Can I use the Archlifter™?

The good news about traction is it is quite variable. You can use small forces over longer periods of time to help get relief in cases of prior neck surgery. Your head and neck weigh in at about 5 to 10 kg. You will need at least this much force to have a counteractive effect on the forces of gravity. If you have had prior neck surgery and are planning to use the Archlifter™, please inform your health care professional of your plans and ask for guidance and/or monitoring. Make sure your provider is familiar with the Archlifter™ traction and treatment method by sharing this information with him or her.

I have had a serious head or neck injury or accident. Can I use the Archlifter™?

Prudence is the best policy. Seek the advice of your doctor.

I have a medical problem. Can I use the Archlifter™?

Again prudence is the best policy. Seek the advice of your doctor.

Can the Archlifter™ be used with children?

The Archlifter™ has not been tested in underage individuals. There is a similar traction method in use (Halo traction) for many years in children. This traction method involves cranial fixation (a surgical procedure) followed by a period of regular traction use in young scoliosis patients. The halo traction treatment lasts for several weeks or months in the pre-surgical phase of scoliosis correction. Halo traction helps to line up the vertebrae in the spine to facilitate an easier and less-complicated surgical correction. Archlifter™ traction therapy produces the same quality of traction, however since the Archlifter™ transmits the traction forces through the maxillary bone (the upper jaw) it is unclear if there will be any adverse effects of these forces on bone growth and development in growing individuals or individuals with palatal or facial bony defects. If your doctor suggests Archlifter™ traction therapy as an alternative to halo traction, I suggest that an orthodontist or dentist make a lateral cephalogram x-ray image and record the orthodontic landmarks prior, during and after the traction therapy, a neurological assessment prior, during and after treatment and perhaps bone-density monitoring while in treatment. In addition, Vitamin D, Calcium supplements along with regular sunlight exposure is recommended. (2) Through vigilant monitoring, the treatment can be halted or modified if necessary. Current research suggests an extended period of traction “as long as possible” (3) prior to surgical intervention. It may be beneficial to use the Archlifter™ and light forces over an extended period prior to surgical intervention or to halo traction use.

What side-effects are associated with traction therapy?

Most of the symptoms of spinal degeneration are caused by the slow accumulation of the effects of gravity and slouching or screen hunch. It’s these daily forces on your back and neck that add up over time. Traction with the Archlifter™ should be thought of as a daily antidote to gravity and screen hunch. This is where the Archlifter™ shines- it allows you to counteract gravity and screen hunch at the same rate- daily in your own home.

Most of the side-effects of traction therapy are associated with sudden large increases in traction forces. With adults in treatment, these side effects may be:

  • Muscle spasms
  • Soreness in the neck, shoulders and back.

If you have any of these symptoms, please discontinue traction treatments until the symptoms resolve. When you re-start traction, use a lighter traction force, and more gradual increases in force or weights.

Rarely: Headache, dizziness and nausea, hearing or vision problems.
Discontinue traction and consult your doctor before attempting traction again.

What contraindications are there to traction therapy?

Please consult your doctor before using traction therapy if you have:

  • any moderate to severe medical problem.
  • rheumatoid arthritis.
  • postsurgery hardware such as screws in your neck.
  • a recent fracture or injury in the neck area.
  • a known tumor in the neck area.
  • a bone infection.
  • issues or blockages with vertebral or carotid arteries.
  • osteoporosis.
  • cervical instability.
  • spinal or cervical hypermobility.

Will my Archlifter device ship with a Medical Product Label?

Yes, there will be the device label (instructions) as required by your country.

Hygiene: Please use the Archlifter™ with a plastic hygienic barrier to avoid cross contamination. If you have a swelling or sores in your mouth or an active oral infection, please refrain from using the Archlifter™ until completely resolved.

FDA 510k exempt:
888.5850 Nonpowered Orthopedic
Traction Apparatus And Accessories.

Citations:

(1) Piccin CF, Pozzebon D, Scapini F, Corrêa ECR. Craniocervical Posture in Patients with Obstructive Sleep Apnea. International Archives of Otorhinolaryngology. 2016;20(3):189-195. doi:10.1055/s-0036-1584295.

(2) Xiao Han, Weixiang Sun, Yong Qiu, et al., “Halo Gravity Traction Is Associated with Reduced Bone Mineral Density of Patients with Severe Kyphoscoliosis,” BioMed Research International, vol. 2016, Article ID 8056273, 7 pages, 2016. https://doi.org/10.1155/2016/8056273.

(3) Slow and gradual preoperative Halo Traction provides safe correction of severe scoliosis in patients with Osteogenesis Imperfecta. To, Michael et al. Spine Deformity, Volume 5, Issue 6, 448, November, 2017

Start with a slight amount of weight, and gradually increase the applied weight until you work the kinks out.The Archlifter™ is very effective! Dr. Savage has other ideas to help make health care more efficient, effective and cost less. With your help, we can bring this product to market and make patients everywhere healthier and happier. We would also like to conduct more research on how to help patients who suffer from scoliosis and advanced cervical disease. We also want to document how using the Archlifter™ can help patients with sleep apnea. With your help and backing, the research can be done as the Archlifter™ balanced traction technology becomes widely known and adopted.The EUArchlifter™ will also be in Tübingen, Germany shortly as we expand to serve the EU marketplace. We hope to bring our healing technology to Europe and beyond.Project Owner:  Devin Savage D.M.D.Business Strategy Consultant: Thomas E. Savage Sr. MBA, CBCCrowdfunding Management/IT support: Beth and Doug EckersleyIP: Michael J. Gallagher Esq.Legal: Eric Rosenberg (Rosenberg and Ball Co. LPA, Granville, OH)Testing and Evaluation: Dr. Thomas Walters/Dr. Lisa Walters (Erie, PA)Design and Manufacturing Tech: Mark Mnich and Johannes Hertrich, Priority Designs,Columbus, OHRene Cailliet M.D., medical author and former director of the department of physical medicine and rehabilitation at the University of Southern California stated:“Head in forward posture can add up to thirty pounds of abnormal leverage on the cervical spine. This can pull the entire spine out of alignment. Forward head posture (FHP) may result in the loss of 30% of vital lung capacity. These breath-related effects are primarily due to the loss of the cervical lordosis, which blocks the action of the hyoid muscles, especially the inferior hyoid responsible for helping lift the first rib during inhalation.”There is a growing body of evidence accumulating in the literature supporting the hypothesis that anatomical alterations, including Forward Head Posture, contribute to sleep disordered breathing. At least one study concluded that the further forward the head posture, the more strong the association with Obstructive Sleep Apnea (1). Forward head posture (or text-neck) can increase the upper airway resistance in children as well as adults. This can contribute to Upper Airway Resistance Syndrome (UARS). This syndrome is characterized by a general lack of sleep, poor posture and dental malformations. If you or your child exhibit these symptoms, please seek help from a specialized sleep center for complete diagnosis. Does the FDA regulate traction devices?Under the published Code of Federal Regulations, 888.5850 - CFR - Code of Federal Regulations Title 21 the regulation reads:§ 888.5850 Nonpowered orthopedic traction apparatus and accessories.(a)Identification. A nonpowered orthopedic traction apparatus is a device that consists of a rigid frame with nonpowered traction accessories, such as cords, pulleys, or weights, and that is intended to apply a therapeutic pulling force to the skeletal system.(b)Classification. Class I (general controls). The device is exempt from the premarket notification procedures in subpart E of part 807 of this chapter, subject to the limitations in § 888.9. The device is also exempt from the current good manufacturing practice requirements of the quality system regulation in part 820 of this chapter, with the exception of § 820.180, regarding general requirements concerning records, and § 820.198, regarding complaint files. [ 52 FR 33702, Sept. 4, 1987, as amended at 66 FR 38815, July 25, 2001]What amount of weight can I use with the Archlifter™?This is where sensibility is the best policy. To use the Universal Version of the Archlifter™ start with a small traction force. This means that when you attach the Archlifter™ to the sturdy overhead support (such as a pull up bar) use the extension straps (included) to bring the traction device to head level. After mounting into the device, grab onto the handles and slowly start to bend your knees to place some of your weight on the Archlifter™. A small amount of weight is the best place to start. Once you start to feel the traction forces in your neck, hold steady without adding more weight for a minute. Increase the time and traction force (body weight) as you can tolerate. It’s common to feel a bit of soreness the day after. This should not cause you to worry, but if you do feel soreness, back off your routine to allow the soreness to resolve before moving on with your traction routine. Large, sudden increases in traction forces are associated with a higher incidence of side-effects, while slower, incremental increases in traction forces are better tolerated. For many smaller adults, a peak traction force of only 35 lbs over time is sufficient to reverse the effects of gravity and screen hunch, while larger individuals may need a peak traction force of 50 to 75 lbs plus. There is no reason or known benefit to use more than 50% of body weight. In obese adults the percentage of body weight will be smaller, and using the ideal weight to calculate traction force is more realistic and reasonable.I have dentures. Can I use the Archlifter™?The Archlifter™ has an interchangeable strut that supports the maxillary pusher. The maxillary pusher can be one of two types: The Universal Version or the Dentist Version. The Universal Version was designed to be used independent of teeth, no teeth or palate size. If you are a denture or partial denture wearer, please take the removable dentures out before using the Archlifter™. The palate pusher applies forces to the roof of the mouth (the palate) and the denture may break or interfere with the function of the soft silicone pushing pad. Your dentist can fabricate a custom made palatal coverage appliance specifically to function with the Archlifter™.I have a palatal torus. Can I use the Archlifter™?A palatal torus is a small or large benign bony lump that is sometimes on the roof of the mouth. The palatal pushing pad is very soft and should not irritate the torus. However, if your torus is unusually large or sensitive, try using the super-soft sleeve that fits over the palatal pad. This will make for more of a mouthful, but will have additional cushioning power.I have a very narrow, tall palate. Can I use the Archlifter™?If your palate is unusually small or narrow or V-shaped, you best option is to use the super-soft sleeve over the palatal pad. The sleeve may overlap onto the teeth a bit. You should still be able to use the Archlifter™. If you are still having problems finding a comfortable fit, please visit your dentist for advice and solutions.I have weak, questionable teeth or bridges in my upper jaw. Can I use the Archlifter™?In this case- whether you know you already have questionable or bad or decayed teeth, old bridges, loose teeth, crowns or fillings, or gum disease or implants, you must get checked by your dentist prior to using the Archlifter™.I have a cleft palate. Can I use the Archlifter™?If you have a cleft palate, with or without an obturator, you should ask your dentist whether or not the Universal Version is appropriate. The super-soft sleeve solves most of these problems, however your dentist will need to determine the suitability of your palate to absorb the traction forces. In the case there is little or no actual bone in the palatal area, your best advice may be to have a custom dental appliance made by your dentist. Please consult your dental professional for more information.I have had head and/or neck surgery. Can I use the Archlifter™?The good news about traction is it is quite variable. You can use small forces over longer periods of time to help get relief in cases of prior neck surgery. Your head and neck weigh in at about 5 to 10 kg. You will need at least this much force to have a counteractive effect on the forces of gravity. If you have had prior neck surgery and are planning to use the Archlifter™, please inform your health care professional of your plans and ask for guidance and/or monitoring. Make sure your provider is familiar with the Archlifter™ traction and treatment method by sharing this information with him or her.I have had a serious head or neck injury or accident. Can I use the Archlifter™?Prudence is the best policy. Seek the advice of your doctor.I have a medical problem. Can I use the Archlifter™?Again prudence is the best policy. Seek the advice of your doctor.Can the Archlifter™ be used with children?The Archlifter™ has not been tested in underage individuals. There is a similar traction method in use (Halo traction) for many years in children. This traction method involves cranial fixation (a surgical procedure) followed by a period of regular traction use in young scoliosis patients. The halo traction treatment lasts for several weeks or months in the pre-surgical phase of scoliosis correction. Halo traction helps to line up the vertebrae in the spine to facilitate an easier and less-complicated surgical correction. Archlifter™ traction therapy produces the same quality of traction, however since the Archlifter™ transmits the traction forces through the maxillary bone (the upper jaw) it is unclear if there will be any adverse effects of these forces on bone growth and development in growing individuals or individuals with palatal or facial bony defects. If your doctor suggests Archlifter™ traction therapy as an alternative to halo traction, I suggest that an orthodontist or dentist make a lateral cephalogram x-ray image and record the orthodontic landmarks prior, during and after the traction therapy, a neurological assessment prior, during and after treatment and perhaps bone-density monitoring while in treatment. In addition, Vitamin D, Calcium supplements along with regular sunlight exposure is recommended. (2) Through vigilant monitoring, the treatment can be halted or modified if necessary. Current research suggests an extended period of traction “as long as possible” (3) prior to surgical intervention. It may be beneficial to use the Archlifter™ and light forces over an extended period prior to surgical intervention or to halo traction use.What side-effects are associated with traction therapy?Most of the symptoms of spinal degeneration are caused by the slow accumulation of the effects of gravity and slouching or screen hunch. It’s these daily forces on your back and neck that add up over time. Traction with the Archlifter™ should be thought of as a daily antidote to gravity and screen hunch. This is where the Archlifter™ shines- it allows you to counteract gravity and screen hunch at the same rate- daily in your own home.Most of the side-effects of traction therapy are associated with sudden large increases in traction forces. With adults in treatment, these side effects may be:
Muscle spasms
Soreness in the neck, shoulders and back.
If you have any of these symptoms, please discontinue traction treatments until the symptoms resolve. When you re-start traction, use a lighter traction force, and more gradual increases in force or weights.Rarely: Headache, dizziness and nausea, hearing or vision problems.Discontinue traction and consult your doctor before attempting traction again.What contraindications are there to traction therapy?Please consult your doctor before using traction therapy if you have:
any moderate to severe medical problem.
rheumatoid arthritis.
postsurgery hardware such as screws in your neck.
a recent fracture or injury in the neck area.
a known tumor in the neck area.
a bone infection.
issues or blockages with vertebral or carotid arteries.
osteoporosis.
cervical instability.
spinal or cervical hypermobility.
Will my Archlifter device ship with a Medical Product Label?Yes, there will be the device label (instructions) as required by your country.Hygiene: Please use the Archlifter™ with a plastic hygienic barrier to avoid cross contamination. If you have a swelling or sores in your mouth or an active oral infection, please refrain from using the Archlifter™ until completely resolved.FDA 510k exempt:888.5850 Nonpowered OrthopedicTraction Apparatus And Accessories.Citations:(1) Piccin CF, Pozzebon D, Scapini F, Corrêa ECR. Craniocervical Posture in Patients with Obstructive Sleep Apnea. International Archives of Otorhinolaryngology. 2016;20(3):189-195. doi:10.1055/s-0036-1584295.(2) Xiao Han, Weixiang Sun, Yong Qiu, et al., “Halo Gravity Traction Is Associated with Reduced Bone Mineral Density of Patients with Severe Kyphoscoliosis,” BioMed Research International, vol. 2016, Article ID 8056273, 7 pages, 2016. https://doi.org/10.1155/2016/8056273.(3) Slow and gradual preoperative Halo Traction provides safe correction of severe scoliosis in patients with Osteogenesis Imperfecta. To, Michael et al. Spine Deformity, Volume 5, Issue 6, 448, November, 2017

story:
Vie Zone is the neuro earphones that analyze your brain activity and use music neurofeedback and to help you relieve stress and reach optimal focus and stay there for longer. With Vie Zone you can stay calm, get focus anytime, anywhere.

Being free from distracting noise is important to developing focus, Vie Zone's patented "SoftShell" technology provides superior comfort for longer periods of time and has a high passive noise-reducing capability to create the perfect isolation from distracting noises.

Neurofeedback has been used as a brain-enhancing technique by many elite athletes and CEOs to help them achieve peak performance. Until now it has been nearly inaccessible due to the high cost and technical complexity. Vie Zone unlocks this ability for everyone. By combining the power of neurofeedback and personalized AI-selected music, Vie Zone helps you to hyper-focus and get into the flow state, anywhere, anytime.

Concentrating too hard for too long can wear out your brain and your body. Vie Zone analyzes your brain fatigue level and lets you know when a break is needed.

When your brain fatigue level is too high, Vie Zone offers neurofeedback sound meditation and binaural beats to help you to relieve stress and recover your optimal mental state faster than ever before. 

 

VieZone tracks your mental performance, so you can see how long you stay focused during your work, how much your brain is fatigued and how well you have recovered during the sound meditation, so you can learn to manage your mental well-being over time.

Vie Zone comes with various soothing music and focus music to create the perfect environment for your mental performance.  Whether it's your favorite jazz tune, soothing music, binaural beats or ASMR, just select your favorite songs from our premium music selections and the global music services.

Vie Style has successfully released a series of high-quality Bluetooth audio products on Kickstarter. Our proprietary audio technology ensures supreme sound quality and superior comfort.

Vie Zone is co-developed and partnered with worldwide recognized organizations; The University of Tokyo, KDDI and NTT Data. The University of Tokyo published the first research paper about Vie Zone and accepted by the 43rd Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. Through the series of studies, Vie Zone is scientifically proven to be highly efficient and effective.

We are easily distracted today by the flood of texts, emails and message notifications making us less productive and unable to focus. This problem has rapidly accelerated now that many of us work from home.

According to research by Carnegie Mellon University,  on average a person loses focus every 11 min and then requires 25 minutes to get back on task. That means we lose 30,000 minutes just being distracted yearly. VieZone helps you to stay focused and recover faster when you happen to lose focus.

 

 

 

Check out the founder & CEO, Yazz doing a live demo of how Vie Zone works.

Vie Zone is the most efficient, effective, scientifically proved, organic way to meditate, enhance focus, train your mind with a lot of fun and without any stress.

Vie Zone is co-developed and partnered with worldwide recognized organizations; The University of Tokyo, KDDI and NTT Data. The University of Tokyo is considered to be the most selective and prestigious university in Japan and ranks among the top 25  universities of the world. The research paper published by the University of Tokyo has been accepted by the 43rd Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society.

Both KDDI and NTT Data are two of Japan's top major telecommunication companies. Through a series of studies, Vie Zone has been scientifically proven to be effective and highly efficient.

Vie Zone is an elegantly designed smart device that uses earphones to pick up brain activity (EEG) and heart rate (ECG). It uses two soft rubber ear-tip sensors that can fit into your ear comfortably along with two neck sensors.

Neurofeedback is a type of brain enhancement training used by top athletes and executives to improve mental performance. It can tune your brain just by watching videos or listening to audio. This method has been medically proven and is widely used for mental performance training of athletes, executives, military forces as well as being used in mental clinics as a treatment for mental illnesses like ADHD, bipolar disorder and depression.

VieZone improves your productivity, reduces stress and helps you recover from brain fatigue just by listening to music. Getting into focus has never been easier.

We all know music can affect your mood, feelings and mental state.  At Vie Zone we embrace that in a positive way. We combine neuroscience with the power of music to tune your brain and improve focus.

Every brain is different. That's why we have developed a system to adapt to your unique state. Vie Zone doesn’t just analyze focus and calm states -  it can learn your individual brain pattern and create your own personal model.

Just select your most important tasks, either for mental work, athletics or creative work and Vie Zone will help you reach your optimum focus level every time you do your task. Vie Zone will learn from your own brain activity and adapt to you.

We have partnered with The University of Tokyo since 2020 to develop the ZONE AI. The system uses In-Ear EEG earphones to analyze the flow state (a.k.a. eustress) and enhance productivity. This project was run successfully and the first research paper was published.

In-Ear EEG Technology traditionally has experienced a lot of challenges. Reduced signal amplitude, as well as a reduction in the number of brain regions in which activity can be measured, were significant limitations to this method.

Vie Zone goes beyond this limit.  Along with NTT DATA, Vie Zone co-developed an “EAR2BRAIN” signal reconstruction system utilizing AI to reconstruct the full scalp EEG signal from a casual In-Ear device resulting in the ability to detect a wider range of brain activity with higher accuracy.

It’s no secret music can affect your mood, feelings and mental state. We ran a scientific research study with KDDI (a major Japanese telecom company) to learn more about how music affects us while using Vie Zone.

The result showed that your favorite music is the most effective intervention to your mental state. Vie Zone's AI-powered music player will create personal playlists that affect your mood the most.

We started this project in 2016. During the last 5 years, we have developed a number of different prototypes to ensure Vie Zone picks up high-quality signals as well as being ultra-comfortable to wear.

 

VIE ZONE

  • The development of a eustress sensing system using In-Ear EEG Kazutaka Ueda, Yasuhiko Imamura, and Takuya Ibaraki (IEEE : techrxiv.org, 06,2021, accepted by 43rd Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society)
  • Experiment Conducted in Collaboration with VIE STYLE Applying Neuro-Tech to Entertainment (KDDI Crop Press Release, June, 02, 2021)
  • NTT DATA INSTITUTE OF MANAGEMENT CONSULTING and VIE STYLE, have succeeded to improve the accuracy of the IN-EAR EEG signal by the reconstruction of the scalp EEG signals from IN-EAR EEG signal. 

IN-EAR EEG

  • The In-the-Ear Recording Concept By David Looney, Preben Kidmose, Cheolsoo Park,Michael Ungstrup, Mike Lind Rank, Karin Rosenkranz, and Danilo P. Mandic
  • Ear-EEG detects ictal and interictal abnormalities in focal and generalized epilepsy – A comparison with scalp EEG monitoring, I.C. Zibrandtsen, P. Kidmose , C.B. Christensen , T.W. Kjaer

SIGNAL RECONSTRUCTION TECHNIQUE

  • Electrical fingerprint of the amygdala guides neurofeedback training for stress resilience, Jackob N. Keynan, Avihay Cohen, Gilan Jackont, Nili Green, Noam Goldway, Alexander Davidov, Yehudit Meir-Hasson, Gal Raz, Nathan Intrator, Eyal Fruchter, Keren Ginat, Eugene Laska, Marc Cavazza & Talma Hendler

MUSIC and NEUROFEEDBACK

  • A closed-loop, music-based brain-computer interface for emotion mediation, Stefan K. Ehrlich ,Kat R. Agres,Cuntai Guan,Gordon Cheng

PRODUCTIVITY

  • Brain, Interrupted, The New York Times, By Bob Sullivan and Hugh Thompson

story:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3cFYSa-2Jq4

Thank you for your interest!

About 5 years ago, we set off on a mission to bring the healthful benefits of the sun inside to help employers and employees alike, create healthy, exciting, energetic and productive work environments!

We’ve all heard how the sun is critical to our overall well-being…and how today’s society spends less and less time out in it. The lack of sunlight has had a profound effect on our healthfulness. “Reduced energy, performance, slowed metabolism, insomnia and even depression are part of a growing list of issues associated with this migration indoors. Wouldn’t it be great if you could improve your health and wellness naturally by simply bringing the sun to work with you?! Our young company allows you to do exactly that.

Summarily:

We build smart, personal lighting systems that pack the colored light spectrum of a bright, sunlit sky into a sophisticated and sexy desk lamp, used as you would an ordinary one, but that actually delivers the energizing benefits of the sun, indoors, where you need it most!

Our journey began with a love for the outdoors and the constant desire to be in the sun. 

Many of us continue to struggle through the gloomy winter months! We drew inspiration from these long dark days to ensure that although the harsh weather will inevitably return, thanks to the LifeLight Touch, many of us will be basking in the healthful benefits of the sun no matter what the weather, season or time of day.

After months of research and development with an exceptionally talented team of technologists and medical professionals, we were able to deliver the LifeLight Touch to an amazing collection of enterprise clients.

Those partners including TJX, BAE, Barclays, Digital Credit Union (DCU) and Todd & Weld, to name a few, provided valuable feedback that allowed us to optimize the production design. 

Now we need your help to make the LifeLight Touch a production reality!

Through your support and backing of this IndieGoGo campaign, not only will you receive the first and only natural, energy boosting, personal, sunlight delivery system, but your support will help Sun LifeLight make this life changing system available to all that spend so much of their day indoors, no matter where they live!

The system is purpose built for use by computer using office professionals, students and home based workers that spend most of their workday indoors. With this simple yet sophisticated and patent protected system, those that don't receive the energizing benefits of being in the sun while at work, can still gain those natural, energy amplifying, mood enhancing and productivity boosting attributes at or around their computer workstations!

Corporations and individuals alike, benefit by virtually transporting their workstations to sun drenched destinations!

Computer-using office professionals, students and home based workers do not receive enough sunlight during the workday to maintain a healthy existence. As a result, It's virtually impossible for anyone that works indoors to operate at their peak. Depression, obesity, and type 2 diabetes are at epidemic proportions and have all been shown to have links to sunlight deprivation. The resulting absenteeism, presenteeism and a general malaise in the workplace, as productivity demands continue to increase, has proven costly for employers and individuals alike.

Please, find the following report from Thomas Jefferson University Department of Neurology, that succinctly explains how humans are "wired" to benefit from the sun. 

The founders of the world renowned LEED Building Standard have developed the WELL Building Standard that focuses on the human centric side of interior spaces. Their standard speaks plainly about the need for "Circadian Lighting" as a cornerstone to improve employee health and wellness. The LifeLight Touch delivers more than the amount detailed in this lighting category. The simple solution: Bring the effective, soft, “sky blue” color of a bright sunny day to every workstation...The result, a happier, healthier and more productive workforce and or individual, within days.

A recent report by Shadab Rahman, PhD. from Brigham & Women's hospital Boston, MA shows how Sun LifeLight’s technology is at the forefront of this healthful, productivity boosting revolution.

System Overview

Used as you would an ordinary desk lamp, this unique system allows users to interactively decide exactly how much sun they feel they need on a daily basis. The LifeLight Touch (available now) allows a user to adjust the brightness and duration of light through a learning integrated touch screen. Simply adjust the levels with a swipe of your finger, position the light to shine down into your eyes from above (typically from behind and above a workstation display as pictured below) and out of your field of view. Start enjoying the energizing benefits of use within a few days. The LifeLight Learn (available soon) combined with the Sun Seeker App (available soon) uses a mobile application to control and monitor the light wirelessly, while the system actually gets smarter over time. Using its sophisticated algorithm, the app recommends the appropriate amount of sunlight each and every day based on a variety of inputs including weather, sleep quality, personal schedules and even favorite athletic team schedules.

LifeLight Touch...Stylish and Elegant Simplicity

  • High tech brushed aluminum desk lamp
  • Color selected LEDs
  • Controlled using simple swipes of a finger on a glass touchscreen panel built into the base
  • Infinitely adjust the brightness of the soft, sky blue light
  • Adjust the timer for up to 8 hours of use with a simple swipe of the finger
  • Uniquely flexible positioning system allows any user to direct the effective light into the eyes from above to eliminate glare, the way nature intended

SunSeeker App...Sophisticated Utility

SunSeeker App Available Soon
 

  • Personalized Control and Monitoring Mobile App
  • Bluetooth connection to the LifeLight Learn
  • Provides individually Customized, daily recommended sunlight levels for maximum benefit
  • Built with proprietary algorithm using Multiple Internet of Things (IoT) inputs such as:
    •  Weather
    •  Personal schedule
    • Athletic team schedules
    • Wearable device data such as sleep quality, etc.
  • Interactive algorithm learns each users optimum sunlight levels for peak performance

  • The Only Effective Colored Wavelength -The LifeLight Touch (available now) delivers the only therapeutically effective wavelength of light ~480nm (sky blue). It therefore operates at far less intensity while being more effective than any other solution. 
  • Connected and Responsive App -The LifeLight Learn (available soon) is the first app controlled, “Internet of things” (IoT) connected lighting product that leverages a multitude of external sensor based inputs. No other product has the ability to automatically incorporate outside variables and user dynamics that directly impact the amount of sunlight that is most effective for each individual user. 
  • Customized Sunlight Algorithm -By learning each user’s personal preferences the Sun Seeker app (available soon) algorithmically calculates the optimum amount of sunlight each and every day. 
  • Reduces Light Pollution –In an office environment filled with competing visual stimuli (monitors, overhead lighting, etc.) the LifeLight Touch only adds the specific wavelength of light required and reduces visual stress. 
  • Ergonomic Design -Unlike other bulky and disruptive light therapy products it’s unique compact and flexible form factor was developed to direct the light down into the eye and out of the field of view, the way nature intended. Position the LifeLight Touch to shine down from above your computer display and you'll receive all of the effective light energy without even noticing the LifeLight Touch is there!

Top 50 Finalist out of over 1,900 global applicants in Sir Richard Branson's Extreme Tech Challenge late 2014 into early 2015. Presented at the Monster Products Pavilion at the 2015 Consumer Electronics Show (CES2015).

/http://www.extremetechchallenge.com/2015-top-10/

Finalist in STAPLES (Fall 2014) Crowd2Shelf Contest out of close to 1,000 global applicants.
